title: Process Type Foundry: New Releases, Upgrades & Discounts
content:
Submitted by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808141318/http:/typophile.com/user/108 "View user profile.") : 10.Jan.2006 1.25pm 

————————————————————-  
Happy New Year!

The Process Type Foundry is pleased to announce the release of Bryant 2, Bryant Pro, Bryant Condensed and Bryant Compressed.

What started out as a simple tune-up of Bryant (released in 2002) blossomed/exploded into a full scale re-drawing and expansion. Four weights with alternates turned into four weights with alternates, alternate-alternates, italics, small caps, multiple numeral styles, extended language support and two completely new widths: Condensed and Compressed. In addition to the expansion, each glyph of Bryant was redrawn to improve what needed improving while retaining its key qualities: a san serif with open, geometric forms and rounded tips.

Try out any of the new Bryants with our Test Typer or view the PDF Specimens:

————————————————————-  
Upgrading From Bryant to Bryant 2  
————————————————————-  
If you previously purchased Bryant through us and would like to purchase the new Bryant (now called Bryant 2 or Pro), there are several options for upgrading at significantly reduced prices:

1.) Purchase the same weight or style configuration for a small upgrade price.

2.) Or, purchase additional weights or styles in conjunction with the upgrade of the original purchase.

For a full explanation of upgrade options and pricing visit:  
 [http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/upgrade.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808141318/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/upgrade.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/upgrade.html")

————————————————————-  
Maple - Now 20% off!  
————————————————————-

Maple, released the first half of 2005, was recently named by Typographic as one of their favorite fonts of the year (http:// typographi.com/001045.php).

To celebrate, we’re offering Maple at a 20% discount for one month. If you’re in the mood for an irregular grotesque taking inspiration from 19th and early 20th centuries models, this is your month.

More about Maple:  
 [http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808141318/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/index.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/index.html")
